member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build
member.summary: Information about a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Artifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Artifacts.
Information about the output artifacts for the build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.BuildBatchArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatchArn.
The ARN of the batch build that this build is a member of, if applicable.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.BuildComplete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildComplete.
Whether the build is complete. True if complete; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.BuildNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildNumber.
The number of the build. For each project, the buildNumber of its first build is 1. The buildNumber of each subsequent build is incremented by 1. If a build is deleted, the buildNumber of other builds does not change.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.BuildStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildStatus.
The current status of the build. Valid values include:
FAILED: The build failed.
FAULT: The build faulted.
IN_PROGRESS: The build is still in progress.
STOPPED: The build stopped.
SUCCEEDED: The build succeeded.
TIMED_OUT: The build timed out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Cache
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cache.
Information about the cache for the build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.CurrentPhase
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentPhase.
The current build phase.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.DebugSession
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DebugSession.
Contains information about the debug session for this build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
When the build process ended, expressed in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
Information about the build environment for this build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.ExportedEnvironmentVariables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportedEnvironmentVariables.
A list of exported environment variables for this build.
Exported environment variables are used in conjunction with CodePipeline to export environment variables from the current build stage to subsequent stages in the pipeline. For more information, see Working with variables in the CodePipeline User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.FileSystemLocations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemLocations.
An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for a CodeBuild build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique ID for the build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Initiator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Initiator.
The entity that started the build. Valid values include:
If CodePipeline started the build, the pipeline's name (for example, codepipeline/my-demo-pipeline).
If an IAM user started the build, the user's name (for example, MyUserName).
If the Jenkins plugin for CodeBuild started the build, the string CodeBuild-Jenkins-Plugin.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Logs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Logs.
Information about the build's logs in CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.NetworkInterface
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NetworkInterface.
Describes a network interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Phases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Phases.
Information about all previous build phases that are complete and information about any current build phase that is not yet complete.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the CodeBuild project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.QueuedTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutes.
The number of minutes a build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.ReportArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportArns.
An array of the ARNs associated with this build's reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.ResolvedSourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResolvedSourceVersion.
An identifier for the version of this build's source code.
For CodeCommit, GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, and BitBucket, the commit ID.
For CodePipeline, the source revision provided by CodePipeline.
For Amazon S3, this does not apply.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.SecondaryArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifacts.
An array of ProjectArtifacts objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.SecondarySources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySources.
An array of ProjectSource objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.SecondarySourceVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourceVersions.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. Each ProjectSourceVersion must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example, pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The name of a service role used for this build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
Information about the source code to be built.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
Any version identifier for the version of the source code to be built. If sourceVersion is specified at the project level, then this sourceVersion (at the build level) takes precedence.
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
When the build process started, expressed in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.TimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMinutes.
How long, in minutes, for CodeBuild to wait before timing out this build if it does not get marked as completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Build.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
If your CodeBuild project accesses resources in an Amazon VPC, you provide this parameter that identifies the VPC ID and the list of security group IDs and subnet IDs. The security groups and subnets must belong to the same VPC. You must provide at least one security group and one subnet ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts
member.summary: Information about build output artifacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.ArtifactIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactIdentifier.
An identifier for this artifact definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.BucketOwnerAccess
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BucketOwnerAccess.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.EncryptionDisabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionDisabled.
Information that tells you if encryption for build artifacts is disabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
Information about the location of the build artifacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.Md5sum
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Md5sum.
The MD5 hash of the build artifact.
You can use this hash along with a checksum tool to confirm file integrity and authenticity.
This value is available only if the build project's packaging value is set to ZIP.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.OverrideArtifactName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OverrideArtifactName.
If this flag is set, a name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name. The name specified in a buildspec file is calculated at build time and uses the Shell Command Language. For example, you can append a date and time to your artifact name so that it is always unique.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildArtifacts.Sha256sum
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sha256sum.
The SHA-256 hash of the build artifact.
You can use this hash along with a checksum tool to confirm file integrity and authenticity.
This value is available only if the build project's packaging value is set to ZIP.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch
member.summary: Contains information about a batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The ARN of the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Artifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Artifacts.
A BuildArtifacts object the defines the build artifacts for this batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.BuildBatchConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BuildBatchConfig.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.BuildBatchNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatchNumber.
The number of the batch build. For each project, the buildBatchNumber of its first batch build is 1. The buildBatchNumber of each subsequent batch build is incremented by 1. If a batch build is deleted, the buildBatchNumber of other batch builds does not change.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.BuildBatchStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatchStatus.
The status of the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.BuildGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildGroups.
An array of BuildGroup objects that define the build groups for the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.BuildTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildTimeoutInMinutes.
Specifies the maximum amount of time, in minutes, that the build in a batch must be completed in.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Cache
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Cache.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Complete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Complete.
Indicates if the batch build is complete.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.CurrentPhase
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentPhase.
The current phase of the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.DebugSessionEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DebugSessionEnabled.
Specifies if session debugging is enabled for this batch build. For more information, see Viewing a running build in Session Manager. Batch session debugging is not supported for matrix batch builds.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the batch build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The date and time that the batch build ended.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Environment
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.FileSystemLocations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemLocations.
An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for the batch build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Initiator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Initiator.
The entity that started the batch build. Valid values include:
If CodePipeline started the build, the pipeline's name (for example, codepipeline/my-demo-pipeline).
If an IAM user started the build, the user's name.
If the Jenkins plugin for CodeBuild started the build, the string CodeBuild-Jenkins-Plugin.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.LogConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LogConfig.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Phases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Phases.
An array of BuildBatchPhase objects the specify the phases of the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.QueuedTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutes.
Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, that the batch build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.ResolvedSourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResolvedSourceVersion.
The identifier of the resolved version of this batch build's source code.
For CodeCommit, GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, and BitBucket, the commit ID.
For CodePipeline, the source revision provided by CodePipeline.
For Amazon S3, this does not apply.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.SecondaryArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifacts.
An array of BuildArtifacts objects the define the build artifacts for this batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.SecondarySources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySources.
An array of ProjectSource objects that define the sources for the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.SecondarySourceVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourceVersions.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. Each ProjectSourceVersion must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example, pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The name of a service role used for builds in the batch.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.Source
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Source.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
The identifier of the version of the source code to be built.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The date and time that the batch build started.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatch.VpcConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchFilter
member.summary: Specifies filters when retrieving batch builds.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchFilter.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the batch builds to retrieve. Only batch builds that have this status will be retrieved.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchPhase
member.summary: Contains information about a stage for a batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchPhase.Contexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contexts.
Additional information about the batch build phase. Especially to help troubleshoot a failed batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchPhase.DurationInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DurationInSeconds.
How long, in seconds, between the starting and ending times of the batch build's phase.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchPhase.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
When the batch build phase ended, expressed in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildBatchPhase.PhaseStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PhaseStatus.
The current status of the batch build phase. Valid values include:
FAILED
The build phase failed.
FAULT
The build phase faulted.
IN_PROGRESS
The build phase is still in progress.
STOPPED
The build phase stopped.
SUCCEEDED

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildPhase.PhaseType
member.summary:

BUILD

COMPLETED
The build has been completed.
DOWNLOAD_SOURCE
Source code is being downloaded in this build phase.
FINALIZING
The build process is completing in this build phase.
INSTALL
Installation activities typically occur in this build phase.
POST_BUILD
Post-build activities typically occur in this build phase.
PRE_BUILD
Pre-build activities typically occur in this build phase.
PROVISIONING
The build environment is being set up.
QUEUED
The build has been submitted and is queued behind other submitted builds.
SUBMITTED
The build has been submitted.
UPLOAD_ARTIFACTS

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildStatusConfig.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
Specifies the context of the build status CodeBuild sends to the source provider. The usage of this parameter depends on the source provider.
Bitbucket
This parameter is used for the name parameter in the Bitbucket commit status. For more information, see build in the Bitbucket API documentation.
GitHub/GitHub Enterprise Server
This parameter is used for the context parameter in the GitHub commit status. For more information, see Create a commit status in the GitHub developer guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.BuildStatusConfig.TargetUrl
member.summary:

GitHub/GitHub Enterprise Server
This parameter is used for the target_url parameter in the GitHub commit status. For more information, see Create a commit status in the GitHub developer guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Artifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Artifacts.
Information about the build output artifacts for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.BadgeEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BadgeEnabled.
Set this to true to generate a publicly accessible URL for your project's build badge.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.BuildBatchConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatchConfig.
A ProjectBuildBatchConfig object that defines the batch build options for the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Cache
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cache.
Stores recently used information so that it can be quickly accessed at a later time.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.ConcurrentBuildLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConcurrentBuildLimit.
The maximum number of concurrent builds that are allowed for this project.
New builds are only started if the current number of builds is less than or equal to this limit. If the current build count meets this limit, new builds are throttled and are not run.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description that makes the build project easy to identify.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
Information about the build environment for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.FileSystemLocations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemLocations.
An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for a CodeBuild build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.LogsConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogsConfig.
Information about logs for the build project. These can be logs in CloudWatch Logs, logs uploaded to a specified S3 bucket, or both.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.QueuedTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutes.
The number of minutes a build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.SecondaryArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifacts.
An array of ProjectArtifacts objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.SecondarySources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySources.
An array of ProjectSource objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.SecondarySourceVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourceVersions.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. If secondarySourceVersions is specified at the build level, then they take precedence over these secondarySourceVersions (at the project level).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to interact with dependent Amazon Web Services services on behalf of the Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
Information about the build input source code for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
A version of the build input to be built for this project. If not specified, the latest version is used. If specified, it must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
If sourceVersion is specified at the build level, then that version takes precedence over this sourceVersion (at the project level).
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tag key and value pairs associated with this build project.
These tags are available for use by Amazon Web Services services that support CodeBuild build project tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.TimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMinutes.
How long, in minutes, from 5 to 480 (8 hours), for CodeBuild to wait before it times out any build that has not been marked as completed. The default is 60 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectRequest.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
VpcConfig enables CodeBuild to access resources in an Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateProject operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateProjectResponse.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
Information about the build project that was created.

A ReportExportConfig object that contains information about where the report group test results are exported.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateReportGroupRequest.Name
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateReportGroupRequest.Tags
member.summary:

These tags are available for use by Amazon Web Services services that support CodeBuild report group tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateReportGroupRequest.Type
member.summary:

The type of report group.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateReportGroupResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateReportGroup operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateReportGroupResponse.ReportGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportGroup.
Information about the report group that was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateWebhook operation. For an existing CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, enables CodeBuild to start rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
If you enable webhooks for an CodeBuild project, and the project is used as a build step in CodePipeline, then two identical builds are created for each commit. One build is triggered through webhooks, and one through CodePipeline. Because billing is on a per-build basis, you are billed for both builds. Therefore, if you are using CodePipeline, we recommend that you disable webhooks in CodeBuild. In the CodeBuild console, clear the Webhook box. For more information, see step 5 in Change a Build Project's Settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest.BranchFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BranchFilter.
A regular expression used to determine which repository branches are built when a webhook is triggered. If the name of a branch matches the regular expression, then it is built. If branchFilter is empty, then all branches are built.
It is recommended that you use filterGroups instead of branchFilter.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest.BuildType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildType.
Specifies the type of build this webhook will trigger.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest.FilterGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterGroups.
An array of arrays of WebhookFilter objects used to determine which webhooks are triggered. At least one WebhookFilter in the array must specify EVENT as its type.
For a build to be triggered, at least one filter group in the filterGroups array must pass. For a filter group to pass, each of its filters must pass.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the CodeBuild project.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateWebhook operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookResponse.Webhook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Webhook.
Information about a webhook that connects repository events to a build project in CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DebugSession.SessionEnabled
member.summary:

Specifies if session debugging is enabled for this build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DebugSession.SessionTarget
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DeleteReportGroupRequest.DeleteReports
member.summary:

If false, you must delete any reports in the report group. Use ListReportsForReportGroup to get the reports in a report group. Use DeleteReport to delete the reports. If you call DeleteReportGroup for a report group that contains one or more reports, an exception is thrown.

member.summary:

An array of CodeCoverage objects that contain the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeCodeCoveragesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there are more items to return, this contains a token that is passed to a subsequent call to DescribeCodeCoverages to retrieve the next set of items.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeTestCases operation. Returns a list of details about test cases for a report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesRequest.Filter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.
A TestCaseFilter object used to filter the returned reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of paginated test cases returned per response. Use nextToken to iterate pages in the list of returned TestCase objects. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
During a previous call, the maximum number of items that can be returned is the value specified in maxResults. If there more items in the list, then a unique string called a nextToken is returned. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call. To get all of the items in the list, keep calling this operation with each subsequent next token that is returned, until no more next tokens are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesRequest.ReportArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportArn.
The ARN of the report for which test cases are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeTestCases operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
During a previous call, the maximum number of items that can be returned is the value specified in maxResults. If there more items in the list, then a unique string called a nextToken is returned. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call. To get all of the items in the list, keep calling this operation with each subsequent next token that is returned, until no more next tokens are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.DescribeTestCasesResponse.TestCases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestCases.
The returned list of test cases.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.EnvironmentVariable
member.summary: Information about an environment variable for a build project or a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name or key of the environment variable.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of environment variable. Valid values include:
PARAMETER_STORE: An environment variable stored in Systems Manager Parameter Store. To learn how to specify a parameter store environment variable, see env/parameter-store in the CodeBuild User Guide.
PLAINTEXT: An environment variable in plain text format. This is the default value.
SECRETS_MANAGER: An environment variable stored in Secrets Manager. To learn how to specify a secrets manager environment variable, see env/secrets-manager in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The value of the environment variable.
We strongly discourage the use of PLAINTEXT environment variables to store sensitive values, especially Amazon Web Services secret key IDs and secret access keys. PLAINTEXT environment variables can be displayed in plain text using the CodeBuild console and the CLI. For sensitive values, we recommend you use an environment variable of type PARAMETER_STORE or SECRETS_MANAGER.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ExportedEnvironmentVariable
member.summary:
Contains information about an exported environment variable.
Exported environment variables are used in conjunction with CodePipeline to export environment variables from the current build stage to subsequent stages in the pipeline. For more information, see Working with variables in the CodePipeline User Guide.
During a build, the value of a variable is available starting with the install phase. It can be updated between the start of the install phase and the end of the post_build phase. After the post_build phase ends, the value of exported variables cannot change.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ExportedEnvironmentVariable.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the exported environment variable.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ExportedEnvironmentVariable.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The value assigned to the exported environment variable.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetReportGroupTrend operation. Analyzes and accumulates test report values for the specified test reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendRequest.NumOfReports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumOfReports.
The number of reports to analyze. This operation always retrieves the most recent reports.
If this parameter is omitted, the most recent 100 reports are analyzed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendRequest.ReportGroupArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportGroupArn.
The ARN of the report group that contains the reports to analyze.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendRequest.TrendField
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrendField.
The test report value to accumulate. This must be one of the following values:
Test reports: DURATION
Accumulate the test run times for the specified reports.
PASS_RATE
Accumulate the percentage of tests that passed for the specified test reports.
TOTAL
Accumulate the total number of tests for the specified test reports.
Code coverage reports: BRANCH_COVERAGE
Accumulate the branch coverage percentages for the specified test reports.
BRANCHES_COVERED
Accumulate the branches covered values for the specified test reports.
BRANCHES_MISSED
Accumulate the branches missed values for the specified test reports.
LINE_COVERAGE
Accumulate the line coverage percentages for the specified test reports.
LINES_COVERED
Accumulate the lines covered values for the specified test reports.
LINES_MISSED
Accumulate the lines not covered values for the specified test reports.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetReportGroupTrend operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendResponse.RawData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawData.
An array that contains the raw data for each report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.GetReportGroupTrendResponse.Stats
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Stats.
Contains the accumulated trend data.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ImportSourceCredentials operation. Imports the source repository credentials for an CodeBuild project that has its source code stored in a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest.AuthType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthType.
The type of authentication used to connect to a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository. An OAUTH connection is not supported by the API and must be created using the CodeBuild console.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest.ServerType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerType.
The source provider used for this project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest.ShouldOverwrite
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShouldOverwrite.
Set to false to prevent overwriting the repository source credentials. Set to true to overwrite the repository source credentials. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest.Token
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Token.
For GitHub or GitHub Enterprise, this is the personal access token. For Bitbucket, this is the app password.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsRequest.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
The Bitbucket username when the authType is BASIC_AUTH. This parameter is not valid for other types of source providers or connections.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ImportSourceCredentials operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ImportSourceCredentialsResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the token.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListBuildBatchesForProject operation. Retrieves the identifiers of the build batches for a specific project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest.Filter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.
A BuildBatchFilter object that specifies the filters for the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken value returned from a previous call to ListBuildBatchesForProject. This specifies the next item to return. To return the beginning of the list, exclude this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectRequest.SortOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortOrder.
Specifies the sort order of the returned items. Valid values include:
ASCENDING: List the batch build identifiers in ascending order by identifier.
DESCENDING: List the batch build identifiers in descending order by identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListBuildBatchesForProject operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectResponse.Ids
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ids.
An array of strings that contains the batch build identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildBatchesForProjectResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there are more items to return, this contains a token that is passed to a subsequent call to ListBuildBatchesForProject to retrieve the next set of items.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
During a previous call, if there are more than 100 items in the list, only the first 100 items are returned, along with a unique string called a nextToken. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call. To get all of the items in the list, keep calling this operation with each subsequent next token that is returned, until no more next tokens are returned.

The name of the CodeBuild project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ListBuildsForProjectRequest.SortOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortOrder.
The order to sort the results in. The results are sorted by build number, not the build identifier. If this is not specified, the results are sorted in descending order.
Valid values include:
ASCENDING: List the build identifiers in ascending order, by build number.
DESCENDING: List the build identifiers in descending order, by build number.
If the project has more than 100 builds, setting the sort order will result in an error.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.ConcurrentBuildLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConcurrentBuildLimit.
The maximum number of concurrent builds that are allowed for this project.
New builds are only started if the current number of builds is less than or equal to this limit. If the current build count meets this limit, new builds are throttled and are not run.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Created
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Created.
When the build project was created, expressed in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description that makes the build project easy to identify.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>). If you don't specify a value, CodeBuild uses the managed CMK for Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
Information about the build environment for this build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.FileSystemLocations
member.summary:

An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for a CodeBuild build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.LastModified
member.summary:

When the build project's settings were last modified, expressed in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.LogsConfig

Gets and sets the property SecondarySources.
An array of ProjectSource objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.SecondarySourceVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourceVersions.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. If secondarySourceVersions is specified at the build level, then they take over these secondarySourceVersions (at the project level).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to interact with dependent Amazon Web Services services on behalf of the Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
Information about the build input source code for this build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
A version of the build input to be built for this project. If not specified, the latest version is used. If specified, it must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
If sourceVersion is specified at the build level, then that version takes precedence over this sourceVersion (at the project level).
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tag key and value pairs associated with this build project.
These tags are available for use by Amazon Web Services services that support CodeBuild build project tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.TimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMinutes.
How long, in minutes, from 5 to 480 (8 hours), for CodeBuild to wait before timing out any related build that did not get marked as completed. The default is 60 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Information about the VPC configuration that CodeBuild accesses.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Project.Webhook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Webhook.
Information about a webhook that connects repository events to a build project in CodeBuild.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts
member.summary: Information about the build output artifacts for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.ArtifactIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactIdentifier.
An identifier for this artifact definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.BucketOwnerAccess
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BucketOwnerAccess.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.EncryptionDisabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionDisabled.
Set to true if you do not want your output artifacts encrypted. This option is valid only if your artifacts type is Amazon S3. If this is set with another artifacts type, an invalidInputException is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
Information about the build output artifact location:
If type is set to CODEPIPELINE, CodePipeline ignores this value if specified. This is because CodePipeline manages its build output locations instead of CodeBuild.
If type is set to NO_ARTIFACTS, this value is ignored if specified, because no build output is produced.
If type is set to S3, this is the name of the output bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Along with path and namespaceType, the pattern that CodeBuild uses to name and store the output artifact:
If type is set to CODEPIPELINE, CodePipeline ignores this value if specified. This is because CodePipeline manages its build output names instead of CodeBuild.
If type is set to NO_ARTIFACTS, this value is ignored if specified, because no build output is produced.
If type is set to S3, this is the name of the output artifact object. If you set the name to be a forward slash ("/"), the artifact is stored in the root of the output bucket.
For example:
If path is set to MyArtifacts, namespaceType is set to BUILD_ID, and name is set to MyArtifact.zip, then the output artifact is stored in MyArtifacts/<build-ID>/MyArtifact.zip.
If path is empty, namespaceType is set to NONE, and name is set to "/", the output artifact is stored in the root of the output bucket.
If path is set to MyArtifacts, namespaceType is set to BUILD_ID, and name is set to "/", the output artifact is stored in MyArtifacts/<build-ID>.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.NamespaceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NamespaceType.
Along with path and name, the pattern that CodeBuild uses to determine the name and location to store the output artifact:
If type is set to CODEPIPELINE, CodePipeline ignores this value if specified. This is because CodePipeline manages its build output names instead of CodeBuild.
If type is set to NO_ARTIFACTS, this value is ignored if specified, because no build output is produced.
If type is set to S3, valid values include:
BUILD_ID: Include the build ID in the location of the build output artifact.
NONE: Do not include the build ID. This is the default if namespaceType is not specified.
For example, if path is set to MyArtifacts, namespaceType is set to BUILD_ID, and name is set to MyArtifact.zip, the output artifact is stored in MyArtifacts/<build-ID>/MyArtifact.zip.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.OverrideArtifactName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OverrideArtifactName.
If this flag is set, a name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name. The name specified in a buildspec file is calculated at build time and uses the Shell Command Language. For example, you can append a date and time to your artifact name so that it is always unique.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.Packaging
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Packaging.
The type of build output artifact to create:
If type is set to CODEPIPELINE, CodePipeline ignores this value if specified. This is because CodePipeline manages its build output artifacts instead of CodeBuild.
If type is set to NO_ARTIFACTS, this value is ignored if specified, because no build output is produced.
If type is set to S3, valid values include:
NONE: CodeBuild creates in the output bucket a folder that contains the build output. This is the default if packaging is not specified.
ZIP: CodeBuild creates in the output bucket a ZIP file that contains the build output.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Path.
Along with namespaceType and name, the pattern that CodeBuild uses to name and store the output artifact:
If type is set to CODEPIPELINE, CodePipeline ignores this value if specified. This is because CodePipeline manages its build output names instead of CodeBuild.
If type is set to NO_ARTIFACTS, this value is ignored if specified, because no build output is produced.
If type is set to S3, this is the path to the output artifact. If path is not specified, path is not used.
For example, if path is set to MyArtifacts, namespaceType is set to NONE, and name is set to MyArtifact.zip, the output artifact is stored in the output bucket at MyArtifacts/MyArtifact.zip.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectArtifacts.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of build output artifact. Valid values include:
CODEPIPELINE: The build project has build output generated through CodePipeline.
The CODEPIPELINE type is not supported for secondaryArtifacts.
NO_ARTIFACTS: The build project does not produce any build output.
S3: The build project stores build output in Amazon S3.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBadge
member.summary: Information about the build badge for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBadge.BadgeEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BadgeEnabled.
Set this to true to generate a publicly accessible URL for your project's build badge.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBadge.BadgeRequestUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BadgeRequestUrl.
The publicly-accessible URL through which you can access the build badge for your project.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig
member.summary: Contains configuration information about a batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig.BatchReportMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BatchReportMode.
Specifies how build status reports are sent to the source provider for the batch build. This property is only used when the source provider for your project is Bitbucket, GitHub, or GitHub Enterprise, and your project is configured to report build statuses to the source provider.
REPORT_AGGREGATED_BATCH
(Default) Aggregate all of the build statuses into a single status report.
REPORT_INDIVIDUAL_BUILDS
Send a separate status report for each individual build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig.CombineArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CombineArtifacts.
Specifies if the build artifacts for the batch build should be combined into a single artifact location.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig.Restrictions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Restrictions.
A BatchRestrictions object that specifies the restrictions for the batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
Specifies the service role ARN for the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectBuildBatchConfig.TimeoutInMins
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMins.
Specifies the maximum amount of time, in minutes, that the batch build must be completed in.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectCache
member.summary: Information about the cache for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectCache.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
Information about the cache location:
NO_CACHE or LOCAL: This value is ignored.
S3: This is the S3 bucket name/prefix.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectCache.Modes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Modes.
An array of strings that specify the local cache modes. You can use one or more local cache modes at the same time. This is only used for LOCAL cache types.
Possible values are:
LOCAL_SOURCE_CACHE
Caches Git metadata for primary and secondary sources. After the cache is created, subsequent builds pull only the change between commits. This mode is a good choice for projects with a clean working directory and a source that is a large Git repository. If you choose this option and your project does not use a Git repository (GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket), the option is ignored.
LOCAL_DOCKER_LAYER_CACHE
Caches existing Docker layers. This mode is a good choice for projects that build or pull large Docker images. It can prevent the performance issues caused by pulling large Docker images down from the network.
You can use a Docker layer cache in the Linux environment only.
The privileged flag must be set so that your project has the required Docker permissions.
You should consider the security implications before you use a Docker layer cache.
LOCAL_CUSTOM_CACHE
Caches directories you specify in the buildspec file. This mode is a good choice if your build scenario is not suited to one of the other three local cache modes. If you use a custom cache:
Only directories can be specified for caching. You cannot specify individual files.
Symlinks are used to reference cached directories.
Cached directories are linked to your build before it downloads its project sources. Cached items are overridden if a source item has the same name. Directories are specified using cache paths in the buildspec file.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectCache.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of cache used by the build project. Valid values include:
NO_CACHE: The build project does not use any cache.
S3: The build project reads and writes from and to S3.
LOCAL: The build project stores a cache locally on a build host that is only available to that build host.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment
member.summary: Information about the build environment of the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.Certificate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Certificate.
The ARN of the Amazon S3 bucket, path prefix, and object key that contains the PEM-encoded certificate for the build project. For more information, see certificate in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.ComputeType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComputeType.
Information about the compute resources the build project uses. Available values include:
BUILD_GENERAL1_SMALL: Use up to 3 GB memory and 2 vCPUs for builds.
BUILD_GENERAL1_MEDIUM: Use up to 7 GB memory and 4 vCPUs for builds.
BUILD_GENERAL1_LARGE: Use up to 16 GB memory and 8 vCPUs for builds, depending on your environment type.
BUILD_GENERAL1_2XLARGE: Use up to 145 GB memory, 72 vCPUs, and 824 GB of SSD storage for builds. This compute type supports Docker images up to 100 GB uncompressed.
If you use BUILD_GENERAL1_LARGE:
For environment type LINUX_CONTAINER, you can use up to 15 GB memory and 8 vCPUs for builds.
For environment type LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER, you can use up to 255 GB memory, 32 vCPUs, and 4 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs for builds.
For environment type ARM_CONTAINER, you can use up to 16 GB memory and 8 vCPUs on ARM-based processors for builds.
For more information, see Build Environment Compute Types in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentVariables.
A set of environment variables to make available to builds for this build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.Image
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Image.
The image tag or image digest that identifies the Docker image to use for this build project. Use the following formats:
For an image tag: <registry>/<repository>:<tag>. For example, in the Docker repository that CodeBuild uses to manage its Docker images, this would be aws/codebuild/standard:4.0.
For an image digest: <registry>/<repository>@<digest>. For example, to specify an image with the digest "sha256:cbbf2f9a99b47fc460d422812b6a5adff7dfee951d8fa2e4a98caa0382cfbdbf," use <registry>/<repository>@sha256:cbbf2f9a99b47fc460d422812b6a5adff7dfee951d8fa2e4a98caa0382cfbdbf.
For more information, see Docker images provided by CodeBuild in the CodeBuild user guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.ImagePullCredentialsType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImagePullCredentialsType.
The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build. There are two valid values:
CODEBUILD specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust CodeBuild service principal.
SERVICE_ROLE specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.
When you use a cross-account or private registry image, you must use SERVICE_ROLE credentials. When you use an CodeBuild curated image, you must use CODEBUILD credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.PrivilegedMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrivilegedMode.
Enables running the Docker daemon inside a Docker container. Set to true only if the build project is used to build Docker images. Otherwise, a build that attempts to interact with the Docker daemon fails. The default setting is false.
You can initialize the Docker daemon during the install phase of your build by adding one of the following sets of commands to the install phase of your buildspec file:
If the operating system's base image is Ubuntu Linux:
- nohup /usr/local/bin/dockerd --host=unix:///var/run/docker.sock --host=tcp://0.0.0.0:2375 --storage-driver=overlay&
- timeout 15 sh -c "until docker info; do echo .; sleep 1; done"
If the operating system's base image is Alpine Linux and the previous command does not work, add the -t argument to timeout:
- nohup /usr/local/bin/dockerd --host=unix:///var/run/docker.sock --host=tcp://0.0.0.0:2375 --storage-driver=overlay&
- timeout -t 15 sh -c "until docker info; do echo .; sleep 1; done"

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.RegistryCredential
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryCredential.
The credentials for access to a private registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectEnvironment.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of build environment to use for related builds.
The environment type ARM_CONTAINER is available only in regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), EU (Ireland), Asia Pacific (Mumbai), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Sydney), and EU (Frankfurt).
The environment type LINUX_CONTAINER with compute type build.general1.2xlarge is available only in regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), EU (Ireland), EU (London), EU (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).
The environment type LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER is available only in regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), EU (Ireland), EU (London), EU (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney) , China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).
The environment types WINDOWS_CONTAINER and WINDOWS_SERVER_2019_CONTAINER are available only in regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), and EU (Ireland).
For more information, see Build environment compute types in the CodeBuild user guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation
member.summary: Information about a file system created by Amazon Elastic File System (EFS). For more information, see What Is Amazon Elastic File System?

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
The name used to access a file system created by Amazon EFS. CodeBuild creates an environment variable by appending the identifier in all capital letters to CODEBUILD_. For example, if you specify my_efs for identifier, a new environment variable is create named CODEBUILD_MY_EFS.
The identifier is used to mount your file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
A string that specifies the location of the file system created by Amazon EFS. Its format is efs-dns-name:/directory-path. You can find the DNS name of file system when you view it in the Amazon EFS console. The directory path is a path to a directory in the file system that CodeBuild mounts. For example, if the DNS name of a file system is fs-abcd1234.efs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com, and its mount directory is my-efs-mount-directory, then the location is fs-abcd1234.efs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:/my-efs-mount-directory.
The directory path in the format efs-dns-name:/directory-path is optional. If you do not specify a directory path, the location is only the DNS name and CodeBuild mounts the entire file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation.MountOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MountOptions.
The mount options for a file system created by Amazon EFS. The default mount options used by CodeBuild are nfsvers=4.1,rsize=1048576,wsize=1048576,hard,timeo=600,retrans=2. For more information, see Recommended NFS Mount Options.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation.MountPoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MountPoint.
The location in the container where you mount the file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectFileSystemLocation.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the file system. The one supported type is EFS.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource
member.summary: Information about the build input source code for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.Auth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Auth.
Information about the authorization settings for CodeBuild to access the source code to be built.
This information is for the CodeBuild console's use only. Your code should not get or set this information directly.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.Buildspec
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Buildspec.
The buildspec file declaration to use for the builds in this build project.
If this value is set, it can be either an inline buildspec definition, the path to an alternate buildspec file relative to the value of the built-in CODEBUILD_SRC_DIR environment variable, or the path to an S3 bucket. The bucket must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the build project. Specify the buildspec file using its ARN (for example, arn:aws:s3:::my-codebuild-sample2/buildspec.yml). If this value is not provided or is set to an empty string, the source code must contain a buildspec file in its root directory. For more information, see Buildspec File Name and Storage Location.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.BuildStatusConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildStatusConfig.
Contains information that defines how the build project reports the build status to the source provider. This option is only used when the source provider is GITHUB, GITHUB_ENTERPRISE, or BITBUCKET.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.GitCloneDepth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitCloneDepth.
Information about the Git clone depth for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.GitSubmodulesConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitSubmodulesConfig.
Information about the Git submodules configuration for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.InsecureSsl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InsecureSsl.
Enable this flag to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
Information about the location of the source code to be built. Valid values include:
For source code settings that are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline, location should not be specified. If it is specified, CodePipeline ignores it. This is because CodePipeline uses the settings in a pipeline's source action instead of this value.
For source code in an CodeCommit repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source code and the buildspec file (for example, https://git-codecommit.<region-ID>.amazonaws.com/v1/repos/<repo-name>).
For source code in an Amazon S3 input bucket, one of the following.
The path to the ZIP file that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path>/<object-name>.zip).
The path to the folder that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path-to-source-code>/<folder>/).
For source code in a GitHub repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the buildspec file. You must connect your Amazon Web Services account to your GitHub account. Use the CodeBuild console to start creating a build project. When you use the console to connect (or reconnect) with GitHub, on the GitHub Authorize application page, for Organization access, choose Request access next to each repository you want to allow CodeBuild to have access to, and then choose Authorize application. (After you have connected to your GitHub account, you do not need to finish creating the build project. You can leave the CodeBuild console.) To instruct CodeBuild to use this connection, in the source object, set the auth object's type value to OAUTH.
For source code in a Bitbucket repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the buildspec file. You must connect your Amazon Web Services account to your Bitbucket account. Use the CodeBuild console to start creating a build project. When you use the console to connect (or reconnect) with Bitbucket, on the Bitbucket Confirm access to your account page, choose Grant access. (After you have connected to your Bitbucket account, you do not need to finish creating the build project. You can leave the CodeBuild console.) To instruct CodeBuild to use this connection, in the source object, set the auth object's type value to OAUTH.
If you specify CODEPIPELINE for the Type property, don't specify this property. For all of the other types, you must specify Location.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.ReportBuildStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportBuildStatus.
Set to true to report the status of a build's start and finish to your source provider. This option is valid only when your source provider is GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket. If this is set and you use a different source provider, an invalidInputException is thrown.
To be able to report the build status to the source provider, the user associated with the source provider must have write access to the repo. If the user does not have write access, the build status cannot be updated. For more information, see Source provider access in the CodeBuild User Guide.
The status of a build triggered by a webhook is always reported to your source provider.
If your project's builds are triggered by a webhook, you must push a new commit to the repo for a change to this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.SourceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceIdentifier.
An identifier for this project source. The identifier can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores, and must be less than 128 characters in length.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSource.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of repository that contains the source code to be built. Valid values include:
BITBUCKET: The source code is in a Bitbucket repository.
CODECOMMIT: The source code is in an CodeCommit repository.
CODEPIPELINE: The source code settings are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline.
GITHUB: The source code is in a GitHub or GitHub Enterprise Cloud repository.
GITHUB_ENTERPRISE: The source code is in a GitHub Enterprise Server repository.
NO_SOURCE: The project does not have input source code.
S3: The source code is in an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSourceVersion
member.summary: A source identifier and its corresponding version.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSourceVersion.SourceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceIdentifier.
An identifier for a source in the build project. The identifier can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores, and must be less than 128 characters in length.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.ProjectSourceVersion.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
The source version for the corresponding source identifier. If specified, must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example, pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.PutResourcePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutResourcePolicy operation. Stores a resource policy for the ARN of a Project or ReportGroup object.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.PutResourcePolicyRequest.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
A JSON-formatted resource policy. For more information, see Sharing a Project and Sharing a Report Group in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.PutResourcePolicyRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The ARN of the Project or ReportGroup resource you want to associate with a resource policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.PutResourcePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutResourcePolicy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.PutResourcePolicyResponse.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The ARN of the Project or ReportGroup resource that is associated with a resource policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RegistryCredential
member.summary:
Information about credentials that provide access to a private Docker registry. When this is set:
imagePullCredentialsType must be set to SERVICE_ROLE.
images cannot be curated or an Amazon ECR image.
For more information, see Private Registry with Secrets Manager Sample for CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RegistryCredential.Credential
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credential.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RegistryCredential.CredentialProvider

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report
member.summary: Information about the results from running a series of test cases during the run of a build project. The test cases are specified in the buildspec for the build project using one or more paths to the test case files. You can specify any type of tests you want, such as unit tests, integration tests, and functional tests.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The ARN of the report run.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.CodeCoverageSummary
member.summary:

A CodeCoverageReportSummary object that contains a code coverage summary for this report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Created
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Created.
The date and time this report run occurred.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.ExecutionId
member.summary:

The ARN of the build run that generated this report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Expired
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Expired.
The date and time a report expires. A report expires 30 days after it is created. An expired report is not available to view in CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.ExportConfig
member.summary:

Information about where the raw data used to generate this report was exported.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Name
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.ReportGroupArn

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Status
member.summary:

The status of this report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.TestSummary
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Report.Truncated

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RetryBuildBatchRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RetryBuildBatch operation. Restarts a failed batch build. Only batch builds that have failed can be retried.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RetryBuildBatchRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Specifies the identifier of the batch build to restart.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RetryBuildBatchRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A unique, case sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the RetryBuildBatch request. The token is included in the RetryBuildBatch request and is valid for five minutes. If you repeat the RetryBuildBatch request with the same token, but change a parameter, CodeBuild returns a parameter mismatch error.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.RetryBuildBatchRequest.RetryType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetryType.
Specifies the type of retry to perform.

Specifies the identifier of the build to restart.
