member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3LogsConfig
member.summary: Information about S3 logs for a build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3LogsConfig.BucketOwnerAccess
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BucketOwnerAccess.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3LogsConfig.EncryptionDisabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionDisabled.
Set to true if you do not want your S3 build log output encrypted. By default S3 build logs are encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3LogsConfig.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The ARN of an S3 bucket and the path prefix for S3 logs. If your Amazon S3 bucket name is my-bucket, and your path prefix is build-log, then acceptable formats are my-bucket/build-log or arn:aws:s3:::my-bucket/build-log.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3LogsConfig.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the S3 build logs. Valid values are:
ENABLED: S3 build logs are enabled for this build project.
DISABLED: S3 build logs are not enabled for this build project.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig
member.summary: Information about the S3 bucket where the raw data of a report are exported.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bucket.
The name of the S3 bucket where the raw data of a report are exported.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.BucketOwner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketOwner.
The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket. This allows report data to be exported to an Amazon S3 bucket that is owned by an account other than the account running the build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.EncryptionDisabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionDisabled.
A boolean value that specifies if the results of a report are encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The encryption key for the report's encrypted raw data.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.Packaging
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Packaging.
The type of build output artifact to create. Valid values include:
NONE: CodeBuild creates the raw data in the output bucket. This is the default if packaging is not specified.
ZIP: CodeBuild creates a ZIP file with the raw data in the output bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.S3ReportExportConfig.Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Path.
The path to the exported report's raw data results.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceAuth
member.summary:
Information about the authorization settings for CodeBuild to access the source code to be built.
This information is for the CodeBuild console's use only. Your code should not get or set this information directly.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceAuth.Resource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Resource.
The resource value that applies to the specified authorization type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceAuth.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
This data type is deprecated and is no longer accurate or used.
The authorization type to use. The only valid value is OAUTH, which represents the OAuth authorization type.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceCredentialsInfo
member.summary: Information about the credentials for a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceCredentialsInfo.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the token.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceCredentialsInfo.AuthType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthType.
The type of authentication used by the credentials. Valid options are OAUTH, BASIC_AUTH, or PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.SourceCredentialsInfo.ServerType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerType.
The type of source provider. The valid options are GITHUB, GITHUB_ENTERPRISE, or BITBUCKET.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartBuildBatch operation. Starts a batch build for a project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ArtifactsOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactsOverride.
An array of ProjectArtifacts objects that contains information about the build output artifact overrides for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.BuildBatchConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatchConfigOverride.
A BuildBatchConfigOverride object that contains batch build configuration overrides.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.BuildspecOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildspecOverride.
A buildspec file declaration that overrides, for this build only, the latest one already defined in the build project.
If this value is set, it can be either an inline buildspec definition, the path to an alternate buildspec file relative to the value of the built-in CODEBUILD_SRC_DIR environment variable, or the path to an S3 bucket. The bucket must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the build project. Specify the buildspec file using its ARN (for example, arn:aws:s3:::my-codebuild-sample2/buildspec.yml). If this value is not provided or is set to an empty string, the source code must contain a buildspec file in its root directory. For more information, see Buildspec File Name and Storage Location.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.BuildTimeoutInMinutesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildTimeoutInMinutesOverride.
Overrides the build timeout specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.CacheOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CacheOverride.
A ProjectCache object that specifies cache overrides.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.CertificateOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CertificateOverride.
The name of a certificate for this batch build that overrides the one specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ComputeTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComputeTypeOverride.
The name of a compute type for this batch build that overrides the one specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.DebugSessionEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DebugSessionEnabled.
Specifies if session debugging is enabled for this batch build. For more information, see Viewing a running build in Session Manager. Batch session debugging is not supported for matrix batch builds.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.EncryptionKeyOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKeyOverride.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) that overrides the one specified in the batch build project. The CMK key encrypts the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.EnvironmentTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentTypeOverride.
A container type for this batch build that overrides the one specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.EnvironmentVariablesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentVariablesOverride.
An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that override, or add to, the environment variables defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.GitCloneDepthOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitCloneDepthOverride.
The user-defined depth of history, with a minimum value of 0, that overrides, for this batch build only, any previous depth of history defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.GitSubmodulesConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitSubmodulesConfigOverride.
A GitSubmodulesConfig object that overrides the Git submodules configuration for this batch build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A unique, case sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the StartBuildBatch request. The token is included in the StartBuildBatch request and is valid for five minutes. If you repeat the StartBuildBatch request with the same token, but change a parameter, CodeBuild returns a parameter mismatch error.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ImageOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageOverride.
The name of an image for this batch build that overrides the one specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ImagePullCredentialsTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImagePullCredentialsTypeOverride.
The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your batch build. There are two valid values:
CODEBUILD
Specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust CodeBuild's service principal.
SERVICE_ROLE
Specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.
When using a cross-account or private registry image, you must use SERVICE_ROLE credentials. When using an CodeBuild curated image, you must use CODEBUILD credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.InsecureSslOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InsecureSslOverride.
Enable this flag to override the insecure SSL setting that is specified in the batch build project. The insecure SSL setting determines whether to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code. This override applies only if the build's source is GitHub Enterprise.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.LogsConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogsConfigOverride.
A LogsConfig object that override the log settings defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.PrivilegedModeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrivilegedModeOverride.
Enable this flag to override privileged mode in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.QueuedTimeoutInMinutesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutesOverride.
The number of minutes a batch build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.RegistryCredentialOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryCredentialOverride.
A RegistryCredential object that overrides credentials for access to a private registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ReportBuildBatchStatusOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportBuildBatchStatusOverride.
Set to true to report to your source provider the status of a batch build's start and completion. If you use this option with a source provider other than GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket, an invalidInputException is thrown.
The status of a build triggered by a webhook is always reported to your source provider.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SecondaryArtifactsOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifactsOverride.
An array of ProjectArtifacts objects that override the secondary artifacts defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SecondarySourcesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourcesOverride.
An array of ProjectSource objects that override the secondary sources defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SecondarySourcesVersionOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourcesVersionOverride.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects that override the secondary source versions in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.ServiceRoleOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRoleOverride.
The name of a service role for this batch build that overrides the one specified in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SourceAuthOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceAuthOverride.
A SourceAuth object that overrides the one defined in the batch build project. This override applies only if the build project's source is BitBucket or GitHub.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SourceLocationOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceLocationOverride.
A location that overrides, for this batch build, the source location defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SourceTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceTypeOverride.
The source input type that overrides the source input defined in the batch build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchRequest.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
The version of the batch build input to be built, for this build only. If not specified, the latest version is used. If specified, the contents depends on the source provider:
CodeCommit
The commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
GitHub
The commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
Bitbucket
The commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
Amazon S3
The version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
If sourceVersion is specified at the project level, then this sourceVersion (at the build level) takes precedence.
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartBuildBatch operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildBatchResponse.BuildBatch
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildBatch.
A BuildBatch object that contains information about the batch build.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartBuild operation. Starts running a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ArtifactsOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactsOverride.
Build output artifact settings that override, for this build only, the latest ones already defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.BuildspecOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildspecOverride.
A buildspec file declaration that overrides, for this build only, the latest one already defined in the build project.
If this value is set, it can be either an inline buildspec definition, the path to an alternate buildspec file relative to the value of the built-in CODEBUILD_SRC_DIR environment variable, or the path to an S3 bucket. The bucket must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the build project. Specify the buildspec file using its ARN (for example, arn:aws:s3:::my-codebuild-sample2/buildspec.yml). If this value is not provided or is set to an empty string, the source code must contain a buildspec file in its root directory. For more information, see Buildspec File Name and Storage Location.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.BuildStatusConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildStatusConfigOverride.
Contains information that defines how the build project reports the build status to the source provider. This option is only used when the source provider is GITHUB, GITHUB_ENTERPRISE, or BITBUCKET.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.CacheOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CacheOverride.
A ProjectCache object specified for this build that overrides the one defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.CertificateOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CertificateOverride.
The name of a certificate for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ComputeTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComputeTypeOverride.
The name of a compute type for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.DebugSessionEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DebugSessionEnabled.
Specifies if session debugging is enabled for this build. For more information, see Viewing a running build in Session Manager.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.EncryptionKeyOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKeyOverride.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) that overrides the one specified in the build project. The CMK key encrypts the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.EnvironmentTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentTypeOverride.
A container type for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.EnvironmentVariablesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentVariablesOverride.
A set of environment variables that overrides, for this build only, the latest ones already defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.GitCloneDepthOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitCloneDepthOverride.
The user-defined depth of history, with a minimum value of 0, that overrides, for this build only, any previous depth of history defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.GitSubmodulesConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitSubmodulesConfigOverride.
Information about the Git submodules configuration for this build of an CodeBuild build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A unique, case sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the StartBuild request. The token is included in the StartBuild request and is valid for 5 minutes. If you repeat the StartBuild request with the same token, but change a parameter, CodeBuild returns a parameter mismatch error.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ImageOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageOverride.
The name of an image for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ImagePullCredentialsTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImagePullCredentialsTypeOverride.
The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build. There are two valid values:
CODEBUILD
Specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust CodeBuild's service principal.
SERVICE_ROLE
Specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.
When using a cross-account or private registry image, you must use SERVICE_ROLE credentials. When using an CodeBuild curated image, you must use CODEBUILD credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.InsecureSslOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InsecureSslOverride.
Enable this flag to override the insecure SSL setting that is specified in the build project. The insecure SSL setting determines whether to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code. This override applies only if the build's source is GitHub Enterprise.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.LogsConfigOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogsConfigOverride.
Log settings for this build that override the log settings defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.PrivilegedModeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrivilegedModeOverride.
Enable this flag to override privileged mode in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the CodeBuild build project to start running a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.QueuedTimeoutInMinutesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutesOverride.
The number of minutes a build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.RegistryCredentialOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegistryCredentialOverride.
The credentials for access to a private registry.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ReportBuildStatusOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportBuildStatusOverride.
Set to true to report to your source provider the status of a build's start and completion. If you use this option with a source provider other than GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket, an invalidInputException is thrown.
To be able to report the build status to the source provider, the user associated with the source provider must have write access to the repo. If the user does not have write access, the build status cannot be updated. For more information, see Source provider access in the CodeBuild User Guide.
The status of a build triggered by a webhook is always reported to your source provider.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SecondaryArtifactsOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifactsOverride.
An array of ProjectArtifacts objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SecondarySourcesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourcesOverride.
An array of ProjectSource objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SecondarySourcesVersionOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourcesVersionOverride.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects that specify one or more versions of the project's secondary sources to be used for this build only.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.ServiceRoleOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRoleOverride.
The name of a service role for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SourceAuthOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceAuthOverride.
An authorization type for this build that overrides the one defined in the build project. This override applies only if the build project's source is BitBucket or GitHub.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SourceLocationOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceLocationOverride.
A location that overrides, for this build, the source location for the one defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SourceTypeOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceTypeOverride.
A source input type, for this build, that overrides the source input defined in the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
The version of the build input to be built, for this build only. If not specified, the latest version is used. If specified, the contents depends on the source provider:
CodeCommit
The commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
GitHub
The commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
Bitbucket
The commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
Amazon S3
The version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
If sourceVersion is specified at the project level, then this sourceVersion (at the build level) takes precedence.
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.StartBuildRequest.TimeoutInMinutesOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMinutesOverride.
The number of build timeout minutes, from 5 to 480 (8 hours), that overrides, for this build only, the latest setting already defined in the build project.

member.summary: This is the response object from the StartBuild operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase
member.summary: Information about a test case created using a framework such as NUnit or Cucumber. A test case might be a unit test or a configuration test.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.DurationInNanoSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DurationInNanoSeconds.
The number of nanoseconds it took to run this test case.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.Expired
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Expired.
The date and time a test case expires. A test case expires 30 days after it is created. An expired test case is not available to view in CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A message associated with a test case. For example, an error message or stack trace.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the test case.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.Prefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Prefix.
A string that is applied to a series of related test cases. CodeBuild generates the prefix. The prefix depends on the framework used to generate the tests.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.ReportArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportArn.
The ARN of the report to which the test case belongs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status returned by the test case after it was run. Valid statuses are SUCCEEDED, FAILED, ERROR, SKIPPED, and UNKNOWN.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCase.TestRawDataPath
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestRawDataPath.
The path to the raw data file that contains the test result.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCaseFilter
member.summary: A filter used to return specific types of test cases. In order to pass the filter, the report must meet all of the filter properties.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCaseFilter.Keyword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Keyword.
A keyword that is used to filter on the name or the prefix of the test cases. Only test cases where the keyword is a substring of the name or the prefix will be returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestCaseFilter.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status used to filter test cases. A TestCaseFilter can have one status. Valid values are:
SUCCEEDED
FAILED
ERROR
SKIPPED
UNKNOWN

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestReportSummary.DurationInNanoSeconds
member.summary:

The number of nanoseconds it took to run all of the test cases in this report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestReportSummary.StatusCounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusCounts.
A map that contains the number of each type of status returned by the test results in this TestReportSummary.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.TestReportSummary.Total
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Total.
The number of test cases in this TestReportSummary. The total includes truncated test cases.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateProject operation. Changes the settings of a build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Artifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Artifacts.
Information to be changed about the build output artifacts for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.BadgeEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BadgeEnabled.
Set this to true to generate a publicly accessible URL for your project's build badge.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.BuildBatchConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BuildBatchConfig.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Cache
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cache.
Stores recently used information so that it can be quickly accessed at a later time.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.ConcurrentBuildLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConcurrentBuildLimit.
The maximum number of concurrent builds that are allowed for this project.
New builds are only started if the current number of builds is less than or equal to this limit. If the current build count meets this limit, new builds are throttled and are not run.
To remove this limit, set this value to -1.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A new or replacement description of the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the build output artifacts.
You can use a cross-account KMS key to encrypt the build output artifacts if your service role has permission to that key.
You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK or, if available, the CMK's alias (using the format alias/<alias-name>).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
Information to be changed about the build environment for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.FileSystemLocations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemLocations.
An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for a CodeBuild build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.LogsConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogsConfig.
Information about logs for the build project. A project can create logs in CloudWatch Logs, logs in an S3 bucket, or both.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the build project.
You cannot change a build project's name.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.QueuedTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedTimeoutInMinutes.
The number of minutes a build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.SecondaryArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondaryArtifacts.
An array of ProjectArtifact objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.SecondarySources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySources.
An array of ProjectSource objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.SecondarySourceVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondarySourceVersions.
An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. If secondarySourceVersions is specified at the build level, then they take over these secondarySourceVersions (at the project level).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The replacement ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to interact with dependent Amazon Web Services services on behalf of the Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
Information to be changed about the build input source code for the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.SourceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceVersion.
A version of the build input to be built for this project. If not specified, the latest version is used. If specified, it must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.
For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.
If sourceVersion is specified at the build level, then that version takes precedence over this sourceVersion (at the project level).
For more information, see Source Version Sample with CodeBuild in the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An updated list of tag key and value pairs associated with this build project.
These tags are available for use by Amazon Web Services services that support CodeBuild build project tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.TimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeoutInMinutes.
The replacement value in minutes, from 5 to 480 (8 hours), for CodeBuild to wait before timing out any related build that did not get marked as completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
VpcConfig enables CodeBuild to access resources in an Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateProject operation.

Information about the build project that was changed.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateProjectVisibility operation. Changes the public visibility for a project. The project's build results, logs, and artifacts are available to the general public. For more information, see Public build projects in the CodeBuild User Guide.
The following should be kept in mind when making your projects public:
All of a project's build results, logs, and artifacts, including builds that were run when the project was private, are available to the general public.
All build logs and artifacts are available to the public. Environment variables, source code, and other sensitive information may have been output to the build logs and artifacts. You must be careful about what information is output to the build logs. Some best practice are:
Do not store sensitive values, especially Amazon Web Services access key IDs and secret access keys, in environment variables. We recommend that you use an Amazon EC2 Systems Manager Parameter Store or Secrets Manager to store sensitive values.
Follow Best practices for using webhooks in the CodeBuild User Guide to limit which entities can trigger a build, and do not store the buildspec in the project itself, to ensure that your webhooks are as secure as possible.
A malicious user can use public builds to distribute malicious artifacts. We recommend that you review all pull requests to verify that the pull request is a legitimate change. We also recommend that you validate any artifacts with their checksums to make sure that the correct artifacts are being downloaded.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest.ProjectArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest.ProjectVisibility
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProjectVisibility.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest.ResourceAccessRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceAccessRole.
The ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to access the CloudWatch Logs and Amazon S3 artifacts for the project's builds.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateProjectVisibility operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityResponse.ProjectArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the build project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityResponse.ProjectVisibility
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProjectVisibility.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityResponse.PublicProjectAlias
member.summary:

Contains the project identifier used with the public build APIs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateWebhook operation. Updates the webhook associated with an CodeBuild build project.
If you use Bitbucket for your repository, rotateSecret is ignored.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest.BranchFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BranchFilter.
A regular expression used to determine which repository branches are built when a webhook is triggered. If the name of a branch matches the regular expression, then it is built. If branchFilter is empty, then all branches are built.
It is recommended that you use filterGroups instead of branchFilter.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest.BuildType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildType.
Specifies the type of build this webhook will trigger.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest.FilterGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterGroups.
An array of arrays of WebhookFilter objects used to determine if a webhook event can trigger a build. A filter group must contain at least one EVENT WebhookFilter.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the CodeBuild project.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookRequest.RotateSecret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RotateSecret.
A boolean value that specifies whether the associated GitHub repository's secret token should be updated. If you use Bitbucket for your repository, rotateSecret is ignored.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateWebhookResponse.Webhook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Webhook.
Information about a repository's webhook that is associated with a project in CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.VpcConfig.SecurityGroupIds

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.VpcConfig.VpcId
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook
member.summary: Information about a webhook that connects repository events to a build project in CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.BranchFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BranchFilter.
A regular expression used to determine which repository branches are built when a webhook is triggered. If the name of a branch matches the regular expression, then it is built. If branchFilter is empty, then all branches are built.
It is recommended that you use filterGroups instead of branchFilter.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.BuildType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BuildType.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.FilterGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterGroups.
An array of arrays of WebhookFilter objects used to determine which webhooks are triggered. At least one WebhookFilter in the array must specify EVENT as its type.
For a build to be triggered, at least one filter group in the filterGroups array must pass. For a filter group to pass, each of its filters must pass.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.LastModifiedSecret
member.summary:

A timestamp that indicates the last time a repository's secret token was modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.PayloadUrl

The CodeBuild endpoint where webhook events are sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.Secret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Secret.
The secret token of the associated repository.
A Bitbucket webhook does not support secret.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.Webhook.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to the webhook.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.WebhookFilter
member.summary: A filter used to determine which webhooks trigger a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.WebhookFilter.ExcludeMatchedPattern
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeMatchedPattern.
Used to indicate that the pattern determines which webhook events do not trigger a build. If true, then a webhook event that does not match the pattern triggers a build. If false, then a webhook event that matches the pattern triggers a build.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.WebhookFilter.Pattern
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Pattern.
For a WebHookFilter that uses EVENT type, a comma-separated string that specifies one or more events. For example, the webhook filter PUSH, PULL_REQUEST_CREATED, PULL_REQUEST_UPDATED allows all push, pull request created, and pull request updated events to trigger a build.
For a WebHookFilter that uses any of the other filter types, a regular expression pattern. For example, a WebHookFilter that uses HEAD_REF for its type and the pattern ^refs/heads/ triggers a build when the head reference is a branch with a reference name refs/heads/branch-name.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.WebhookFilter.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of webhook filter. There are six webhook filter types: EVENT, ACTOR_ACCOUNT_ID, HEAD_REF, BASE_REF, FILE_PATH, and COMMIT_MESSAGE.
EVENT
A webhook event triggers a build when the provided pattern matches one of five event types: PUSH, PULL_REQUEST_CREATED, PULL_REQUEST_UPDATED, PULL_REQUEST_REOPENED, and PULL_REQUEST_MERGED. The EVENT patterns are specified as a comma-separated string. For example, PUSH, PULL_REQUEST_CREATED, PULL_REQUEST_UPDATED filters all push, pull request created, and pull request updated events.
The PULL_REQUEST_REOPENED works with GitHub and GitHub Enterprise only.
ACTOR_ACCOUNT_ID
A webhook event triggers a build when a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket account ID matches the regular expression pattern.
HEAD_REF
A webhook event triggers a build when the head reference matches the regular expression pattern. For example, refs/heads/branch-name and refs/tags/tag-name.
Works with GitHub and GitHub Enterprise push, GitHub and GitHub Enterprise pull request, Bitbucket push, and Bitbucket pull request events.
BASE_REF
A webhook event triggers a build when the base reference matches the regular expression pattern. For example, refs/heads/branch-name.
Works with pull request events only.
FILE_PATH
A webhook triggers a build when the path of a changed file matches the regular expression pattern.
Works with GitHub and Bitbucket events push and pull requests events. Also works with GitHub Enterprise push events, but does not work with GitHub Enterprise pull request events.
COMMIT_MESSAGE
A webhook triggers a build when the head commit message matches the regular expression pattern.
Works with GitHub and Bitbucket events push and pull requests events. Also works with GitHub Enterprise push events, but does not work with GitHub Enterprise pull request events.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.AmazonCodeBuildClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CodeBuild
CodeBuild
CodeBuild is a fully managed build service in the cloud. CodeBuild compiles your source code, runs unit tests, and produces artifacts that are ready to deploy. CodeBuild eliminates the need to provision, manage, and scale your own build servers. It provides prepackaged build environments for the most popular programming languages and build tools, such as Apache Maven, Gradle, and more. You can also fully customize build environments in CodeBuild to use your own build tools. CodeBuild scales automatically to meet peak build requests. You pay only for the build time you consume. For more information about CodeBuild, see the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.AmazonCodeBuildClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCodeBuildClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.AmazonCodeBuildClient.CreateWebhook(Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest)
member.summary:
For an existing CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, enables CodeBuild to start rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
If you enable webhooks for an CodeBuild project, and the project is used as a build step in CodePipeline, then two identical builds are created for each commit. One build is triggered through webhooks, and one through CodePipeline. Because billing is on a per-build basis, you are billed for both builds. Therefore, if you are using CodePipeline, we recommend that you disable webhooks in CodeBuild. In the CodeBuild console, clear the Webhook box. For more information, see step 5 in Change a Build Project's Settings.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateWebhook service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateWebhook service method, as returned by CodeBuild.
member.exception: The input value that was provided is not valid.
There was a problem with the underlying OAuth provider.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be created, because an Amazon Web Services resource with the same settings already exists.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be found.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateWebhook Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.AmazonCodeBuildClient.CreateWebhookAsync(Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
For an existing CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, enables CodeBuild to start rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
If you enable webhooks for an CodeBuild project, and the project is used as a build step in CodePipeline, then two identical builds are created for each commit. One build is triggered through webhooks, and one through CodePipeline. Because billing is on a per-build basis, you are billed for both builds. Therefore, if you are using CodePipeline, we recommend that you disable webhooks in CodeBuild. In the CodeBuild console, clear the Webhook box. For more information, see step 5 in Change a Build Project's Settings.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateWebhook service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateWebhook service method, as returned by CodeBuild.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.AmazonCodeBuildClient.UpdateProjectVisibility(Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest)
member.summary:
Changes the public visibility for a project. The project's build results, logs, and artifacts are available to the general public. For more information, see Public build projects in the CodeBuild User Guide.
The following should be kept in mind when making your projects public:
All of a project's build results, logs, and artifacts, including builds that were run when the project was private, are available to the general public.
All build logs and artifacts are available to the public. Environment variables, source code, and other sensitive information may have been output to the build logs and artifacts. You must be careful about what information is output to the build logs. Some best practice are:
Do not store sensitive values, especially Amazon Web Services access key IDs and secret access keys, in environment variables. We recommend that you use an Amazon EC2 Systems Manager Parameter Store or Secrets Manager to store sensitive values.
Follow Best practices for using webhooks in the CodeBuild User Guide to limit which entities can trigger a build, and do not store the buildspec in the project itself, to ensure that your webhooks are as secure as possible.
A malicious user can use public builds to distribute malicious artifacts. We recommend that you review all pull requests to verify that the pull request is a legitimate change. We also recommend that you validate any artifacts with their checksums to make sure that the correct artifacts are being downloaded.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateProjectVisibility service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateProjectVisibility service method, as returned by CodeBuild.
member.exception: The input value that was provided is not valid.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be found.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateProjectVisibility Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeBuild.IAmazonCodeBuild
member.summary:
Interface for accessing CodeBuild
CodeBuild
CodeBuild is a fully managed build service in the cloud. CodeBuild compiles your source code, runs unit tests, and produces artifacts that are ready to deploy. CodeBuild eliminates the need to provision, manage, and scale your own build servers. It provides prepackaged build environments for the most popular programming languages and build tools, such as Apache Maven, Gradle, and more. You can also fully customize build environments in CodeBuild to use your own build tools. CodeBuild scales automatically to meet peak build requests. You pay only for the build time you consume. For more information about CodeBuild, see the CodeBuild User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.IAmazonCodeBuild.CreateWebhook(Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.CreateWebhookRequest)
member.summary:
For an existing CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, enables CodeBuild to start rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
If you enable webhooks for an CodeBuild project, and the project is used as a build step in CodePipeline, then two identical builds are created for each commit. One build is triggered through webhooks, and one through CodePipeline. Because billing is on a per-build basis, you are billed for both builds. Therefore, if you are using CodePipeline, we recommend that you disable webhooks in CodeBuild. In the CodeBuild console, clear the Webhook box. For more information, see step 5 in Change a Build Project's Settings.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateWebhook service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateWebhook service method, as returned by CodeBuild.
member.exception: The input value that was provided is not valid.
There was a problem with the underlying OAuth provider.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be created, because an Amazon Web Services resource with the same settings already exists.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be found.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateWebhook Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeBuild.IAmazonCodeBuild.UpdateProjectVisibility(Amazon.CodeBuild.Model.UpdateProjectVisibilityRequest)
member.summary:
Changes the public visibility for a project. The project's build results, logs, and artifacts are available to the general public. For more information, see Public build projects in the CodeBuild User Guide.
The following should be kept in mind when making your projects public:
All of a project's build results, logs, and artifacts, including builds that were run when the project was private, are available to the general public.
All build logs and artifacts are available to the public. Environment variables, source code, and other sensitive information may have been output to the build logs and artifacts. You must be careful about what information is output to the build logs. Some best practice are:
Do not store sensitive values, especially Amazon Web Services access key IDs and secret access keys, in environment variables. We recommend that you use an Amazon EC2 Systems Manager Parameter Store or Secrets Manager to store sensitive values.
Follow Best practices for using webhooks in the CodeBuild User Guide to limit which entities can trigger a build, and do not store the buildspec in the project itself, to ensure that your webhooks are as secure as possible.
A malicious user can use public builds to distribute malicious artifacts. We recommend that you review all pull requests to verify that the pull request is a legitimate change. We also recommend that you validate any artifacts with their checksums to make sure that the correct artifacts are being downloaded.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateProjectVisibility service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateProjectVisibility service method, as returned by CodeBuild.
member.exception: The input value that was provided is not valid.
The specified Amazon Web Services resource cannot be found.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateProjectVisibility Operation
